metadata.Title: CVE-2020-5211 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: In NetHack before 3.6.5, an invalid extended command in value for the AUTOCOMPLETE configuration file option can cause a buffer overflow resulting in a crash or remote code execution/privilege escalation. This vulnerability affects systems that have NetHack installed suid/sgid and shared systems that allow users to upload their own configuration files. Users should upgrade to NetHack 3.6.5.

notes.Note: msalvatore> Nethack is installed sgid games, but not suid or sgid root.

criterions.comment: nethack: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
